messages.title: Who can stop the Tories?
messages.content: Labour supporters across the country are asking themselves who is best-placed to beat the Tories in their area, to stop their damaging plans. With the Liberal Democrats in government these last five years, the most extreme Tory policies such as cutting the pay of local nurses and teachers or allowing schools to be run for a profit have been stopped in their tracks. But these policies are just waiting to be implemented by the Conservatives if they win on 7th May. The crucial question is 'who can stop the Tories?'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to Conservative cuts to school funding by 10% if they win general election.
Blocking extra £6.5bn cuts to welfare as Tories ask for more.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour cannot win in many places, and only the Liberal Democrats can stop the Tories.

issues.education: Conservatives to cut school funding by 10% if they win general election.
issues.health: Cameron WILL have to cut NHS spending, warns senior Tory.
issues.socialWelfare: Lib Dems block extra £6.5bn cuts to welfare as Tories ask for more.

quotes.text: I'd govern like a true Tory if it wasn't for the Lib Dems.
George Osborne revives divisive plan to let bosses 'hire and fire at will'.
Lib Dems block extra £6.5bn cuts to welfare as Tories ask for more.
Plans to cut public sector wages outside the South East were confirmed by the Chancellor. But Mr Osborne appeared to soft pedal on the policy following negative reaction from the Liberal Democrats.
Cameron WILL have to cut NHS spending, warns senior Tory.

images.caption: Leaflet imagery depicting opposition to Conservative policies and questioning 'Who can stop the Tories?'
